title: Azure Pipelines Agent(s)
description: Downloads latest Azure Pipelines agent for the account, and installs the specified number instances of the agents inside one Windows VM. Registers the agent with the Azure DevOps organization, and adds agents to the specified agent pool. Note - If the overwrite flag is set to true and if the specified agent folder already exists it will be overwritten. If the location has already has a installed agents as a service, the artifact installation will fail.

Account.description: The name of the Azure DevOps account to add the build agent to. This is the value in your Azure DevOps URL: e.g. 'myaccount' in https://dev.azure.com/myaccount.

PersonalAccessToken.description: A personal access token with permissions to add build agents. It will only be used to register the agent.

AgentName.description: The name to give to the agent, as seen by Azure DevOps. If empty, the computer name will be used.

AgentNamePrefix.description: Prefixes every agent with string specified here.

PoolName.description: The agent pool this build agent should be added to.

AgentCount.description: The number of agents to install and add to the pool. Each agent will be named as prefix-agentname-(1..n).

Overwrite.displayName: Overwrite if agent with same name exists
Overwrite.description: If the folder with the agent name already exists, and this is true, the agent will be overwritten, otherwise installation will fail.

RunAsAutoLogon.description:
Enable autologon to run the agent in interactive mode that can sustain machine reboots.
Set this to true if the agents will be used to run UI tests.

WindowsLogonAccount.description:
The Windows logon account which will run the agent.
When autologon is enabled, agent runs as a process in the context of the specified user.

WindowsLogonPassword.description: The Windows logon account password which will run the agent. This is not required for the default NT AUTHORITY\NetworkService account when running as a service.

runCommand.commandToExecute: [concat('powershell.exe -ExecutionPolicy bypass "& ./run.ps1',' -Account ''', parameters('Account'),''' -Overwrite $', parameters('Overwrite'), ' -PersonalAccessToken ''', parameters('PersonalAccessToken'), '''-AgentInstallLocation ''', parameters('AgentInstallLocation'), ''' -AgentName ''', parameters('AgentName'), ''' -runAsAutoLogon $', parameters('runAsAutoLogon') , ' -windowsLogonAccount ''', parameters('windowsLogonAccount'), ''' -windowsLogonPassword ''', parameters('windowsLogonPassword'), ''' -PoolName ''', parameters('PoolName'), ''' -AgentCount ', parameters('AgentCount'), '"')]
